page.title: 18MY DAYS IN PERTON
page.content: I have lived in Perton for six years now. When I moved here with my parents there was nothing here but houses. We went shopping in Telford and I went to a local school. The Public Houses had not been built and there were no real places to go and play. When I first moved here I always wondered what the old buildings round the housing development were. At a later date I found out that some of them were Quarters for the soldiers. If you look carefully you can still find pieces of the old runway in some gardens. On the edge of the Parkway there are still some of the old buildings remaining. Most of the buildings are common rubbish tips today or storage places for local farmers.
